intro: Leuzea chinensis, commonly known as Chinese leuzea, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as marshes and wetlands, and can reach heights of up to two meters. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Leuzea chinensis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for various health benefits.
